reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Kepa brings civil society actors together to act courageously for a world without inequality or poverty. Kepa's strategy highlights in accordance with Agenda 2030 interdependence and the need for structural changes in order to tackle global problems.Kepa's programme consists of three parts: strengthening civil society increasing active citizenship and influencing political decision-making. The main stakeholders are civil society actors in Finland and the global south as well as the general public and politi cal decision-makers in Finland. The programme aims to reduce inequality and is based on Finland's development policy goals. Kepa promotes equality and climate resilience and strengthens its MOs' skills and knowledge in these topics.Kepa is a membership pla tform that consists of more than 300 Finnish CSOs. Kepa helps its members to find new partnerships with e.g. the private sector. It also strengthens civil society's effectiveness and resilience through training and advice services as well as by helping CSO s to find new sources of funding and to develop their work to be more strategic and effectiveKepa provides people information on global justice and on how to take action. This is done through Kepa's communication channels public events and media work. Kepa channels civil society expertise from Finland and the global south to Finnish decision-makers so that they understand and pay attention to the global implications of their decisions. Kepa's advocacy work is focused on the following themes: development coo peration and finance global economics climate justice global education and strong civil society.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is a secondary priority area in this activity
